revised_title: Defining the Yard and Metre in Terms of the Cadmium Red Radiation
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to determine the lengths of the yard and metre in terms of the wave-length of the cadmium red radiation. They used a modified Fabry-Perot method to compare the lengths of three etalons in air and vacuum, and also determined the refractive index of air. The results agreed with previous measurements within a range of four parts in ten million, and suggested the possibility of defining units of length in terms of the wave-length of visible light instead of material standard bars.
